1. Select a layer to multiply

plugins.name: Flow chart
plugins.description:
A flowchart plugin


1. Creating a component: dragging the component from the component box to the canvas/clicking the component in the component box


2. Qucik component insert: click an existing component in the canvas, and you will find an arrow mark; click the arrow mark, and choose the component you want


3. A quick component insert supports components with two different properties: the default property and the modified property


4. The plugin enables quick and continuous connections between components: click component A→hold down shift→click component B→click component C...


----------------------------------------------------


1. 新增组件框：鼠标从组件箱中拖拉组件框至画布；鼠标单击组件箱中组件框


2. 快捷新增组件框：点击已有组件框出现提示箭头→点击提示箭头出现常用组件框→点击组件框


3. 快捷新增组件框支持两类属性的组件框，默认属性和延续当前属性组件框


4. 支持多组件框之间连续快捷连接，点击A组件框→长按shift→点击B组件框→点击C组件框...
plugins.tagline: 1. Link to any content（连接任意内容） 2. Draw a flowchart（绘制流程图）

plugins.name: Figma to React from Quest
plugins.description:
The easiest way to build React Apps using AI. Convert your Figma to ReactJS components automatically. Pixel-perfect to your design, responsive across screen sizes. Export clean, efficient code that is extendable with your custom code or business logic. Try it risk free.



Watch the Intro Video: 

https://youtu.be/v6rMw8-kqr0



Key Features:


  1. Easy to use - convert design to ReactJS just by exporting to Quest. Get clean, extendable code that is production ready.
  2. Works with Figma features like responsiveness, variants, auto layout, etc. 
  3. Use the built-in design system or bring your own.
  4. Supports MUI or Chakra UI Component libraries by default. Using components from their kits convert them into working MUI or Chakra UI components on export. Or you can build your own or bring in your own (Contact us if you’d like to import your existing library).
  5. Set up props, bindings and state triggers easily without writing any code. Convert variants into states or breakpoints automatically.
  6. Export Figma to React: Clean code that is as good as hand-coded by a developer.
  7. Separation of concerns between the presentation layer and the business logic - iterate on your design as often as you want and generate the presentation layer without any development effort.
  8. Use our AI prompt in the Quest Editor to write functionality with natural language.
  9. Add features such as state & element animations, video, sticky to parent, tooltips, grids, lists, etc.
  10. Download entire App or sync to GitHub with intelligent merging
  11. Export as Javascript or Typescript / CRA or Next.js



Risk-free: 


  • Start for free and scale when your team is ready. 
  • Build one component and add it to your existing React app. Build more as you go - no need to throw away what you already have and start over. 



To get started:


  1. Install this plugin
  2. Login to your Quest account
  3. Follow our Quick Start list to build your first component: https://docs.quest.ai/getting-started/quick-start



Learn more: https://quest.ai/

Docs: https://docs.quest.ai/react/

Support: support@quest.ai

accepted.name: Quest
accepted.description:
The better way to build your frontend.

Convert Figma to React:  Clean, extendable, responsive code automatically.

plugins.tagline: Quest AI - Easiest way to build React Apps using AI

plugins.name: Neumorphism
plugins.description:
Create beautiful neumorphistic designs in just a few seconds. Just select anything you would like to "neumorph", open the plugin and boom. It adds shadows and gradient fills to your selection, which you can customize to your needs.


Some cool live-examples of neumorphism on the web:

  • productdesignresources.com
  • icons.theforgesmith.com
  • shape.so


What is neumorphism?

It's a UI trend which is using multiple shadows and gradients to "fake" light and to bring back a more natural and realistic look and feel. Kind of like skeuomorphism in iOS back in 2007. Read more about it here: https://uxdesign.cc/neumorphism-in-user-interfaces-b47cef3bf3a6


A few tips how to create beautiful neumorphic designs:

  • The background layer and the layer you are "neumorphing" should have the same color.
  • If you neumorph' text, be sure to also have it the same color, open the plugin, and when you're done, you can change the text color to a darker one, for better readability.
  • Neumorphism doesn't work on pure white or pure black, because it adds shadows that are darker / brighter than the background/current selection fill. If you use pure white or black, it will miss one of the shadows and it won't feel "neumorphistic" anymore. I'll suggest to take a kind of bluish tint of white / black.


—


Thank you very much for the kind help for the color calculation-algorithm from Adam, he built the site https://neumorphism.io/ on which you can generate neumorphic CSS shadows. Check it out! 🤗


Feature requests? 😊 Questions?

Just hit me on Twitter (@madebyfabian), via mail (hello@madebyfabian.com) or via an Issue on GitHub.


—


Made with ❤️ by Fabian B. in Nuremberg, Germany. Want to support me? Would appreciate that very much! http://buymeacoff.ee/madebyfabian

accepted.description:

plugins.name: Quick Tracing
plugins.description:
Convert any selection(Layer, Frame, Image … ) into a vector. It can even keep its colour.


Tips to be tracing like a pro:

  • Resolution matters, a highly pixelated image will mean that the pixel will get picked up by the tracing algorithm resulting in wavy edges.
  • Selecting the Outline Trace will give you a higher level of detail, but the output will be in black and white.
  • When selecting an image layer, Quick Tracing will use the original image; if you trace an image that has been cropped, or altered, just frame it and run the plugin on the parent frame.
  • If you have a big image, over 2M pixels, it will get downsized before tracing. You can frame the selection, scale it down with the scale tool, and then run the plugin on the parent frame.

plugins.name: Text Styles Generator
plugins.description:
Mass create or update local Text Styles based on formatting of regular text layers.


Here is how this plugin works:


After you called the plugin on one or several text layers, it will check if there is a Local Text Style with the same name as the name of the text layer.


• If Local Text Style with such name doesn't exist, it would be created, based on text layer properties.


• If Local Text style already exists it would be updated, based on text layer properties AND renamed, based on text layer value.


The additional command "Draw Current Text Styles" will generate text layer with applied text style for each found Local Text Style.


Please note, that plugin works only with local styles. You won't be able to update Remote Text Styles as Local Styles would be created instead. To update library styles perform all changes in library files.
plugins.tagline: Generate local text styles out of text layers

plugins.name: Confetti
plugins.description:
Confetti for Figma lets anyone create gorgeous confetti patterns.

1. SELECT ONE OR MORE LAYERS
The selected layer(s) will become your confetti particles.

2. CONFIGURE YOUR CONFETTI
Play around with the settings to create your perfect confetti pattern. Confetti lets you adjust transparency, rotation and size of the confetti particles.

3. GENERATE YOUR CONFETTI
Have a (confetti) blast!

MAKE IT YOUR OWN
Create the confetti pattern you want by changing transparency, rotation, overlap, size, etc.

WORKS WITH COMPONENTS
Use Components instead of regular layers to instantly update your confetti particles without having to re-create the pattern.

CONFETTI USES A GRID

plugins.name: Figma to WordPress
plugins.description:
Convert your Figma designs into WordPress themes

Using our plugin, freelancers, designers and business owners are able to create beautiful WordPress sites directly from your Figma design in a matter of minutes.

  1. Get your site live on our platform in a matter of minutes
  2. Download your WordPress theme to install on your environment
  3. Increase your margins
  4. No developer needed


Try this design:

  1. FIGMA DEMO DESIGN: https://figma-to-wordpress.com/demo-figma-design
  2. AI GENERATED WORDPRESS THEME: https://figma-to-wordpress.com/demo-wordpress-theme


Integrate Figma with WordPress in 5 easy steps

Figma to WordPress offers an easy and clutter-free process to get the result you are looking for in no time.

  1. Add the plugin to Figma and run it
  2. Share your design link
  3. Select the frames that will be created as pages
  4. Our AI model analyzes your design and converts it into a WP theme in a matter of minutes
  5. Check your preview


Get the full process and all our pro-tips in our Getting Started Guide.


Key features of Figma to WordPress conversions

  1. No code required
  2. Unlimited AI credits to generate Unlimited Previews
  3. Fully editable in your WordPress Dashboard. Supports native WordPress elements.
  4. Compatible with WordPress Editor, Site Editor and all major page builder plugins such as Elementor.
  5. Get your site live for free on a Yotako.com sub-domain
  6. Download your theme to use on you own installation (Design plan needed)
  7. Use your own domain on our own managed hosting infrastructure (Hosting plan needed)
  8. Update your website with new designs from the Yotako’s dashboard
  9. SEO ready
  10. Responsive ready


Publish your WordPress website

To publish your new theme, you have three possibilities:

  1. Get it live on a Yotako subdomain (ie. yourcompany.yotako.com) for FREE (forever) - Great to get started
  2. Host it with your own domain (ie. yourcomany.com) on Yotako’s premium hosting plans - Great for business owners
  3. Download your theme and install it on your own environments - Great for designers and freelancers creating client’s websites


Need help?

Write to us at hello@yotako.io, contact support through our Live Chat or create a ticket in our community website.

💡We will help you with any issue to get your beautiful online presence ready!



RESOURCES


  1. DEMO AI GENERATED WEBSITE: https://figma-to-wordpress.com/demo-wordpress-theme
  2. FIGMA DEMO DESIGN: https://figma-to-wordpress.com/demo-wordpress-theme
  3. Our Figma to WordPress website (created with this plugin): https://figma-to-wordpress.com
  4. Full VIDEO WordPress website in a minutes from Figma: https://youtu.be/trwd9GsUgQU
  5. Short video-tutorials: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=YjR7FyI-_qo&list=PLlMEm-QaNKWRPRrD4mu_1HGp_zxxPWHUl
  6. Share your questions, feedback and designs in the Yotako Community: https://community.yotako.io
  7. Created by Yotako: https://yotako.io
  8. GALLERY from users' designs: https://figma-to-wordpress.com/gallery
  9. AFFILIATE PROGRAM: https://figma-to-wordpress.com/affiliate-program/

plugins.name: Type Tool
plugins.description:
The plugin allows you to do more text transformations directly in Figma, without leaving it and doing text transformations in another design tool, like Adobe Photoshop or Adobe InDesign. Plugin has 2 modes: Circle and Curve. Depending on your selection plugin will choose the mode.


☕ Support us on Buy Me a Coffee.


Circle: You can create a circle text, or bend text upward and downward.


  1. Select the text. Important: only one text element should be selected.
  2. Run the “Type Tool” plugin.
  3. Configure radius, rotation, flip, and letter spacing.
  4. Click the “Apply” button.
  5. Enjoy the result.


Curve: You can create Vector(curve) and make your text to follow your vector.


  1. Create a Vector using Pen tool.
  2. Create a Text.
  3. Select both Text and Vector. Important: you should have selected only 2 elements: one Text and one Vector.
  4. Run the “Type Tool” plugin.
  5. Configure height under line, start position and letter spacing.
  6. Click the "Apply" button.
  7. Enjoy the result.
plugins.tagline: Advanced text transformations directly in Figma.

plugins.name: Figit - A massive library of UI Elements
plugins.description:
1000+ drop in ready UI patterns (auto layout option included) to save you hundred's of hours.


Figit is a Figma plugin (now that was a tongue twister) that revolves around the world of auto-layout and makes it easier to create production-ready designs in record time. Don’t believe us? Yeah, a lot of people didn’t either. Until they actually tried it. Probably why you might see us walking around all smug and puffed-up. 


The plugin has a library of over 1000 UI elements from three categories of Web Application, Ecommerce, and Marketing UI Kits. Yeah, sorry we couldn’t incorporate a ‘Thank You, Grandma’ category for all the things she does for us. Although we should because grandmas deserve it. Let us put that in our ‘To-Do’. 


The two things that this plugin offers are Blueprints and Hi-Fidelity UI Elements. It all depends on where you are with your project. 


Blueprints:

The Low Fidelity blueprints can be used as a base to achieve the end results faster. Forget about sitting for hours wondering about where to start from and what the layout should look like (we spend a lot of those hour playing foosball here). With blueprints, you don’t need to invent the wheel from scratch—just select a layout that gets your brain juices flowing and start from there; you can modify everything later according to your requirements. 


High Fidelity UI Elements:

Hi-Fi UI Elements follow a standard design system that you can use to build landing pages, dashboards, and other quick concepts. If you don’t want to start from scratch and want something ready-made that you can modify, Hi-Fi elements will be your BFF. All these production-ready elements can be dropped into your design with a single click (kind of like we say “it’s not you, it’s me”, hit send, and relax back into the arms of our mistresses.)


How to Use:

  1. Open the Plugin
  2. You can start with a Blueprint or just go directly for the High Fidelity UI Kit Designs
  3. Search for your desired section such as ‘Hero’
  4. Search for the Design that matches your vision
  5. Drag and Drop the element to add it to your File
  6. Tweak it according to your preferences
  7. Take a sip of your protein shake
  8. Unalive the population in GTA using BangBangBang
  9. Done


PS: There's always a Website

plugins.name: Figma GPT
plugins.description:
A plugin that can talk with the ChatGPT (It has the same performance as ChatGPT website).

You can easily copy and use the chat texts, and customize the response by adjusting the parameters.

You can also have AI code generation and code completion. The code can be easily copied and executed as code for Figma plugins.

It's up to you how you use it!


🔥 How to use

  1. Get an OpenAI API Key from the OpenAI website.
  2. Run this plugin.
  3. Open the "Settings" tab and input the API Key you got in the "OpenAI API Key" field.
  4. Open the "Chat" or "Code" tab and have fun 🤟


📮 Support

If you have any problem or feedback, please use the GitHub Issues.

This plugin is made by Ryo Nakae 🙎‍♂️.

plugins.name: Find and Replace Colors
plugins.description:
Importing an unorganized design from Sketch APP? Coworker sends you an unfinished template without Figma color styles? Need to unified colors for a template?


FRC(Find and Replace Colors) is made for designers or teams who often need to create or modify templates. It is a quick & easy solution for finding all colors and replacing them as you need.


✅ SUPPORTED


- Multiple or individually selection — default select all supported shape types

- Shape Types: component, instance, slice, frame, group, star, line, ellipse, polygon, rectangle, vector and text

- Fill Types: background, stroke and gradient

- Color: 6-digit hex triplet color

- Find nodes that with match color


❌ UNSUPPORTED


To change shared(named) styles for the entire document, including every page could end up taking a long time and changes outside the current page won't be immediately visible which could be dangerous. Also, there is no existing way to access shared library styles from the current page. As a result, we will NOT support traversing changes for the entire document or to any shared libraries.


💡 As a workaround for non-styled elements you can use the "FIND ONLY" option, once you select all the matched elements, you can use Figma "Selection colors" to replace them with library styles. If the design is well organized, we would recommend using the native Figma feature to switch colors.


HOW TO USE


1. Install `FRC` and run it inside of a project

2. Click the input field next to the corresponding color and enter a new 6-digit hex triplet color

3. OPTIONAL: check or uncheck the replacing types — fill, stroke or gradient

4. Start to replace all matches by hitting the `Replace Colors` button


NOTES


- Native color picker behavior and style would depend on the using of desktop app or in-browser

- All the finding & replacing action would only apply to the page that you run `FRC`

- Develop without opacity option — without too many modifications, especially for templates

- Find & Focus could select all the nodes on the current page with matching color, then you can do whatever you want, like using native Figma "Selection colors" to replace with library color styles

- Not supporting live selection editing — need to close and rerun `FRC`

- Not supporting multiple colors in a same text layer


Built with love by the ©SearchKings team.
plugins.tagline: Quickly recolor for templates

134437.name: Find and Replace Colors
134437.description:
Importing an unorganized design from Sketch APP? Coworker sends you an unfinished template without Figma color styles? Need to unified colors for a template?


FRC(Find and Replace Colors) is made for designers or teams who often need to create or modify templates. It is a quick & easy solution for finding all colors and replacing them as you need.


✅ SUPPORTED


- Multiple or individually selection — default select all supported shape types

- Shape Types: component, instance, slice, frame, group, star, line, ellipse, polygon, rectangle, vector and text

- Fill Types: background, stroke and gradient

- Color: 6-digit hex triplet color

- Find nodes that with match color


❌ UNSUPPORTED


To change shared(named) styles for the entire document, including every page could end up taking a long time and changes outside the current page won't be immediately visible which could be dangerous. Also, there is no existing way to access shared library styles from the current page. As a result, we will NOT support traversing changes for the entire document or to any shared libraries.


💡 As a workaround for non-styled elements you can use the "FIND ONLY" option, once you select all the matched elements, you can use Figma "Selection colors" to replace them with library styles. If the design is well organized, we would recommend using the native Figma feature to switch colors.


HOW TO USE


1. Install `FRC` and run it inside of a project

2. Click the input field next to the corresponding color and enter a new 6-digit hex triplet color

3. OPTIONAL: check or uncheck the replacing types — fill, stroke or gradient

4. Start to replace all matches by hitting the `Replace Colors` button


NOTES


- Native color picker behavior and style would depend on the using of desktop app or in-browser

- All the finding & replacing action would only apply to the page that you run `FRC`

- Develop without opacity option — without too many modifications, especially for templates

- Find & Focus could select all the nodes on the current page with matching color, then you can do whatever you want, like using native Figma "Selection colors" to replace with library color styles

- Not supporting live selection editing — need to close and rerun `FRC`

- Not supporting multiple colors in a same text layer


Built with love by the ©SearchKings team.

plugins.name: Automatic Style Guides
plugins.description:
🔥 Style Guide Generator 🔥

Preparing formal style guide documentation from your local styles (and keeping it updated!) has always felt like double entry to me. But thanks to the Figma API you can now prepare a presentable style guide for clients & developers with a click of a button.


🎥 Watch the tutorial 🎥

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=2svaCq4xmHw


💪 How It Works 💪


Generate Color Swatches

  1. Create some local text & color styles
  2. Press Automatic Style Guides > Generate Color Swatches
  3. A new page called "Style Guide” has been added to your document


Generate A Style Guide

  1. Create some local text & color styles
  2. Press Automatic Style Guides > Generate Style Guide
  3. A new page called "Style Guide” has been added to your document


…or keep your own style guide updated with moustache tags!


  1. Create some local text & color styles
  2. Find the text layer you want updated with your local style property value
  3. Rename that text layer something like {{myTextStyle.fontSize}}
  4. Press Automatic Style Guides > Update Moustache Tags
  5. The text layer named {{myTextStyle.fontSize}} will have its contents updated to myTextStyle's font size (ie. 12px).


Available Merge Tags

Text Styles

  • {{myTextStyle.id}}
  • {{myTextStyle.type}}
  • {{myTextStyle.name}}
  • {{myTextStyle.description}}
  • {{myTextStyle.fontFamily}}
  • {{myTextStyle.fontStyle}}
  • {{myTextStyle.fontSize}}
  • {{myTextStyle.letterSpacing}}
  • {{myTextStyle.lineHeight}}
  • {{myTextStyle.textCase}}
  • {{myTextStyle.textDecoration}}
  • {{myTextStyle.paragraphSpacing}}


Color Styles

  • {{myColorStyle.id}}
  • {{myColorStyle.type}}
  • {{myColorStyle.name}}
  • {{myColorStyle.description}}
  • {{myColorStyle.key}}
  • {{myColorStyle.paints}}
  • {{myColorStyle.r}}
  • {{myColorStyle.g}}
  • {{myColorStyle.b}}
  • {{myColorStyle.a}}
  • {{myColorStyle.rgba}}
  • {{myColorStyle.hex}}
  • {{myColorStyle.hsla}}


🚨 Warnings 🚨

  • Styles that start with a space are not supported.
  • Only the first fill of a local paint style will be used.
  • Ensure that all styles are uniquely named. If not, it will be skipped.
  • Everything is sensitive to case. If something isn't working, double check your sentence case.
  • Please ensure there are no missing fonts in your file before running the plugin.


💥 Bugs or Feature Requests? 💥

Email support@jordangeizer.com - I'd love to hear of any ideas or issues you may have!

plugins.name: Easing Gradients
plugins.description:
Create smooth gradient transitions with cubic easing functions ✨


Allows smoothing of gradient fills in Figma using custom cubic-bézier or step easing functions (think of transition easing). This is especially useful when dealing with transparent gradients but also allows for creative exploration.


Usage


The plugin is 'gradient-agnostic' in that sense that it doesn't care about the type (linear, radial etc.) and orientation of the gradient.

It takes the first and last color stop as parameters and eases the gradient with the given easing function value. One caveat with this is that all other color steps in between are discarded.


The plugin is open source and MIT licensed.

This plugin is based on the great work of Andreas Larsen.

plugins.name: Supa Palette
plugins.description:
The Ultimate Color Palette Generator for Figma


Elevate your design workflow with Supa Palette 5, the premier tool for generating, refining, and managing color palettes effortlessly. Tailored for Figma, it enables designers to craft accessible, harmonious colors swiftly while ensuring consistency, scalability, and efficiency across all projects.


Key Features:


Discover Inspiration: Explore a vast collection of over 50,000 ready-to-use palettes and delve into 15+ popular color systems, including Tailwind, Material UI, and Radix.


Refine and Customize: Enhance your palettes with powerful tools such as the Curve Editor, seamless light/dark mode support, and advanced color spaces like HSL, OKLCH, and RGB.


Hue Shift Functionality: Adjust hues effortlessly to achieve the perfect color balance, adding a new dimension to your design capabilities.


Enhanced Accessibility: Design inclusively with automatic contrast suggestions, a contrast grid compliant with WCAG and APCA standards, and advanced accessibility insights.


Comprehensive Color Systems: Build consistent palettes with prebuilt systems, customizable modes, and standardized structures tailored for accessibility and scalability in modern designs.


Streamlined Workflow: Save palettes as Figma variables, create detailed documentation guides, and export to multiple formats like Tailwind CSS, Material UI, JSON, SCSS, and more.


Time-Saving Automation: Automatically generate palette names, update variables, and produce in-depth color guides, minimizing repetitive tasks and maximizing your creative time.


Supa Palette 5 is your ultimate companion for professional-grade color management. Elevate your Figma projects with unparalleled control, accessibility, and integration capabilities.


Trusted by over 75K designers, Supa Palette simplifies color management so you can focus on creating beautiful designs.

plugins.name: i Charts Generate - line chart / bar chart / pie cahrt / radar chart / scatter / radial
plugins.description:
The only chart plugin that supports variables and custom bar graphics.

----------------------->

What is the difference：

  1. Support use variables，Edit your palette as a variable and upload it, however, Local variables can only be used on the current document; It’s recommended to use variables from other libraries for cross-document compatibility.
  2. More bar chart styles and you can even draw any graph as your own;
  3. Support upload and save your own commonly used fields (xlsx format), so that you can reuse them in the future.
  4. Fetch data and config from existing charts (Useful when you need to adjust the style of a chart but don't want to change its data);

----------------------->

Already supported：

  1. Bar - horizontal and vertical, supports grouping, stacking and other features
  2. Line - horizontal and vertical, supporting various features such as curve, area, stacking, etc.;
  3. Bar and line combination - same as 1 and 2;
  4. Pie - pie charts, donut charts, rose charts, all support 3D extrusion;
  5. Radar – As you know a radar chart;
  6. Scatter - scatter points, also supports bubbles (just provide the third row of data);
  7. Radial - any start and end angles Radial;

Enjoy it and let me know if you have any questions and I will reply as soon as possible.

-------------------------

这应该是目前唯一支持变量和自定义柱条图形的图表插件。

----------------------->

  1. 支持变量，以变量编辑您的调色板然后上传即可，但注意：来源于当前文件的变量仅在当前文件可用，若希望色板跨文件可用，请通过引用已发布的库变量的方式配置色板。
  2. 支持更多的柱条样式和自定义柱条样式
  3. 支持上传和保存你的常用字段，以便将来你能够重复使用它们。
  4. 支持从已创建的图表中获取并回填数据和配置，这在你想调整图表样式而不想改变数据时非常有用。

----------------------->

已支持图表：

  1. 柱图 - 水平和垂直，支持分组、堆叠等各种特性
  2. 线图 - 水平和垂直，支持曲线、面积、堆叠等各种特性；
  3. 柱线组合图 - 同1、2；
  4. 饼图 - 饼图、环图、玫瑰图，全部支持3D挤出;
  5. 雷达图 - 如您所知的雷达图那样;
  6. 散点图- 散点，同时支持气泡（提供第三行数据即可）;

plugins.name: Tracer
plugins.description:
Convert raster graphics to vectors with 1 click!


Effortlessly convert any low-resolution or pixelated image into a sharp and scalable vector graphic, perfect for use in logos, illustrations, and more. Save time and streamline your workflow with our easy-to-use plugin


Select as many images as you want and run the plugin to convert. To ease your workflow even more, Tracer is compatible with Figma quick actions bar (CTRL + / or CTRL + P on Windows and CMD + / or CMD + P on Mac), so you can seamlessly run the plugin!


You can do a "simple" tracing that generate single layer or "detailed" one that generates two of them (useful for coloring)


The plugin is entirely FREE of charge. Happy tracing! ✌️


Need more info?

page - contact - instagram - video

37851.description:
Find all Instances of a Component used in your file.


Select a single Instance or Component, and the plugin will search all pages and all frames and create a list of all Instances used.


The list is split up into seperate pages for easy navigation. Clicking on any item will zoom in on the Instance.


💡 Tip: Use the left and right arrow keys to navigate between instances.
37851.release_notes: Figma fixed a bug causing this plugin to be very slow. it's lightning fast now.

plugins.name: StyleList – text and color styles
plugins.description:
Create text and color styles quicker and easier way for your projects.


 For text styles:

Just enter base size, choose type scale and font settings. Choose sizes that you want and click “Create styles” button. And boom here we go. You just have got all text styles:)


For color styles:

Create multiple palettes and swatches.

You can choose a gender and decide whether you want the random full name, first name or last name.

plugins.name: Nisa Text
plugins.description:
Nisa Text version 2 🎉


Unleash your creative potential with our game-changing Figma text editing plugin. Streamline tasks, boost productivity, and explore new horizons in design. Elevate your text editing experience today!


👉 Release highlights:

  1. Wrap Text (PRO): Effortlessly align text to wrap around chosen shapes, including png/svg images for added versatility. Like in Adobe Indesign.
  2. Super Columns (PRO). Enjoy CSS-like multi columns to split text evenly into multiple columns.
  3. Circle Text (PRO). Create unique circular text by selecting an ellipse and defining the radius.
  4. Hyphenation. Select your text and add hyphenation to it.
  5. Texts To Variables (PRO). Easily move selected texts or frames into variables for convenient editing.
  6. Remove links: Remove all links from text.
  7. Support mixed text - Now you can split/join/etc. and you text style won't be lost!


Main: Split Text, Split Text Al (by alphabet), Split Word, Join Text

Alignment: Arrange Vertically, Arrange Horizontally

Manipulations: Sort, Sort By Length, Shuffle, Reverse, Remove Duplicates, Transform Text, Remove Links


🚀 Upgrade to PRO and access exclusive text editing features and advanced tools.
plugins.tagline: The powerful Figma plugin for text manipulation
